reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Hamilton in January 2011 looking to book a hotel for the Japan-New Zealand game of the Rugby World Cup in September. We were staying at a hotel that did not come up to our expectations and chanced across the Camelot which was almost across the street. The hotel location was excellent as it is in close proximity to the stadium, shops, food and restaurants
reviews.title: World Cup Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tariff was good and they were not increasing it to gouge the overseas tourists. We made a one night deposit to hold the room and returned to Canada.
reviews.title: Simply excellent!

reviews.text: We arrived on schedule and were booked into a room. It was fully equipped although the TV was not very modern.
reviews.title: Clean and spacious!

reviews.text: Management and staff were very friendly and the room was spotless. Parking was very convenient
reviews.title: Very good Motor Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel was very clean, quiet, spacious and comfortable. Facilities include a small swimming pool, gym, laundry, sky TV & spa. The hosts were very friendly. Supermarkets are nearby. The kitchen was good except that the pots/pans were too small for our needs but we managed to cook ourselves a simple dinner. The service was excellent especially the cleaning part. Thank you so much!
reviews.title: Thoroughly Recommended

likes.liked: — The size and facilities in the apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay at the last minute, we got an excellent deal. As we were travelling on motorcycles it was great too as the bikes were out of sight. We will most definitely go back there
reviews.title: Very spacious and comfortable

reviews.text: The first unit we were in was unit 34.After unpacking we were making a hot drink and it took six cups to find one clean enough to use.The plates were the same,they felt like sandpaper to touch.
reviews.title: A bad experience

reviews.text: I suggest they were just rinsed under cold water.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: After complaining we were moved to unit 28.That evening when preparing our meal we found that the pot we needed had no lid, there was no sieve to strain our pasta and the grill in the oven did not work. After again complaining we were allowed to use the stove in an adjacent unit.
reviews.title: Best in Hamilton!

reviews.text: The next day after returning from our sightseeing we found that the rubbish had not been removed by cleaning staff (this is supposed to be a fully serviced facility).
reviews.title: For a family on a budget

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights while playing competitive sport in Hamilton. Very spacious, clean and modern. The only minus with this motel was the spa was out of use because of previous users damaging it and we did book it because it had a spa. Owners very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Top of the range

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. Rooms were immaculate the staff were very friendly the room is modern with a nice 30+ inch flat screen tv the only negative I had was the thin doors I could hear everything outside, people getting into cars at 6am and smokers coughing at 2am.
reviews.title: Great stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would defenantly stay again!!
reviews.title: Quiet and clean, Great facilities, Friendly owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this place by walking the main street. The room had a double spa with free wifi and some sky channels. Flat screen TV and kitchenette which is better than going to the bathroom to fill the jug for a cuppa!. The bed was comfortable and two pillows each. The spa bath/bathroom clean and roomy. Definitely would stay here again if the rate was good. It was ok to have a slightly later checkout which was appreciated. Was about a 15min walk into town. Parking right outside your room. Nice heating inside with a oil heater and heat pump. Needed it for the cool Hamilton morning!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Had 1 night at the Kingsgate and had booked for two but were so disappointed in those rooms decided to look for another place for our second night. Very happy to find this one otherwise our weekend may not have been so good.
reviews.title: Best place we stayed on the N. Island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 1st experience at staying in a Motor Inn. in N,Z.Must say it was a pleasant experience.We were able to stay in, to eat more, which saved quite a lot of money. We were staying 8 nights and were given a up-grade,which made it better. A large Studio room with kitchen and separate bathroom. There was not a lot of kitchen utensils,but we managed to eat in a few nights plus breakfast. We were down the side of a long oblong shaped court yard with cars parking in front of each unit.
reviews.title: Good reasonable priced Motel

reviews.text: Although its quite a busy road outside ,we never heard any noise.The staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful.Room cleaning was done everyday.
reviews.title: Awsome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 2 big Supermarkets nearby ''Countdown and PAKnSAVE'' so shopping was no problem, Good bargains on Wine,for our journey around the North Island. It is possible to walk into town,though after being sightseeing all day.I drove into town,no parking fees after 6-00pm.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We ate out a couple of time,Cafe Centrale,Italian food. (see separate review )
reviews.title: Good place to stay.
